parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the post.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>True. While the post doesn't explicitly mention a specific candidate by name, it clearly refers to Mara Togănel, who is running for office.  The post uses "I" and "me" and refers to her campaign and the trust placed in her by voters. This implicitly identifies her as a candidate.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True. The post is a paid advertisement on Facebook, a public platform, and its message is clearly intended to reach a wide audience, not just a select few. The phrasing "ieși mâine la vot!" (go out to vote tomorrow) is a clear call to action to a broad audience.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>True. The primary objective of the post is to encourage people to vote. While it doesn't explicitly endorse Mara Togănel, the context strongly suggests that the desired outcome is increased voter turnout, which would indirectly benefit her campaign. The personal appeal and the emphasis on her connection to the community aim to build trust and support.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>False. The post lacks the objectivity and neutrality expected of journalistic content. It's a personal appeal from a candidate, focusing on building trust and encouraging participation in the election, rather than providing unbiased information.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>False. While the post expresses personal beliefs ("Cred în Dumnezeu. Cred în mureșeni"), these are used to build a connection with the audience and encourage voting, serving an electoral purpose. It's not a purely personal opinion unrelated to the election.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>606719112020297</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post, while not explicitly urging voters to choose Mara Togănel, functions as electoral propaganda. It leverages her public profile to encourage voting, implicitly benefiting her campaign. The post's paid nature, broad reach, and personal appeal, combined with the timing (a day before the election), strongly suggest an intention to influence the election outcome.  The lack of explicit endorsement is a mitigating factor, but the overall effect is still promotional.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate> <name>Mara Togănel</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>INDEPENDENT</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
Mara Togănel, pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea unei postări plătite pe Facebook (ID: 606719112020297) după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024, care, deși nu îndeamnă explicit la votarea sa, constituie propagandă electorală prin apelul personal la alegători,  accentuând încrederea acordată de peste 47.000 de mureșeni și îndemnând la participarea la vot cu fraza "ieși mâine la vot!", având un efect electoral pozitiv asupra campaniei sale. Postarea, cu o cheltuială de sub 100 RON, a atins 2.000-3.000 de impresii și o estimare a acoperirii de 500.000-1.000.000 de persoane, conform datelor din Ad Library.  Contactul responsabil este mara_toganel@yahoo.com, +40722886771.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
